<a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-5g-sc-1k?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5gsa-supercycle-1k&aid=9467&paid=9467&waid=9467&source=esamnbwdg0210138&psource=esamnbwdg0210138&wsource=esamnbwdg0210138" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="The Motley Fool" style="width:100%;max-width: 146px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="146" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL2NvbXBhbnkvbG9nby8xMi8xNTkzNzAzMTcxLU1vdGxleUZvb2xfTG9nb19PdXRsaW5lV2hpdGUucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0IjoiY29tZXQtbW9ybmluZ2JyZXciLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ=="></a>
</th>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>Maybe pour an extra bowl of Wheaties this morning, because today is packed.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Senate Finance Committee will hold a confirmation hearing for Biden's Treasury Secretary nominee, Janet Yellen. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Bank of America, Goldman Sachs, and Netflix report earnings.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>President Trump is expected to issue at least 100 pardons and commutations on his last full day in office. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And tomorrow is an event that happens at most once every four years: the inauguration of a new president.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/18/biden-rescind-keystone-xl-permit?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Pipeline on the Line
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A map showing the path of the Keystone XL pipeline. The original pipeline goes east from Hardisty, Canada and straight down the middle of the US to Cushing, TX, and Patoka, IN. The proposed XL detour cuts through Montana, South Dakota, and Nebraska. " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNzYyL2tleXN0b25lX3BpcGVsaW5lLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Among a spree of executive orders planned for his first day in office tomorrow, POTUS-elect Joe Biden will reportedly <a href="https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/calgary/biden-keystone-xl-1.5877038?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rescind a permit</a> for the Keystone XL pipeline. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Refresher: </strong>The Keystone XL is a planned 1,210-mile detour from the existing Keystone pipeline, which runs from Canada’s Alberta province to Gulf Coast oil refineries. The Keystone XL would haul 830,000 barrels of crude oil per day through Montana, South Dakota, and Nebraska before reconnecting to the original pipeline. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The American Dream mall of fossil fuel projects, the Keystone XL has been in the works for 15+ years but faced numerous delays and legal setbacks, including former President Obama's 2015 rejection of its permit application.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Why the controversy?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Environmentalists strongly oppose the pipeline because it 1) is an $8 billion investment in harmful fossil fuels 2) cuts through protected wetlands and tribal lands and 3) carries "bitumen" from Alberta’s oil sands, a type of crude oil that creates more pollution. Some major banks have stopped financing all oil sands projects because of the climate impact.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Canada's ambassador to the US says oil sands production and emissions per barrel have improved since the project was announced, and Canadian PM Justin Trudeau and President Trump, supporters of Keystone XL, argue it will reduce reliance on foreign oil and create jobs. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Sunday, the Keystone XL's developer <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/keystone-xl-oil-project-pledges-zero-carbon-emissions-11610930642?mod=hp_lead_pos2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tried convincing</a> Biden it won't be like those other fossil fuel projects, pledging...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>$1.7 billion in solar, wind, and battery investments</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Net-zero emissions after starting service in 2023</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A ~$785 million stake in the project for indigenous tribes</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Canadian portion has been under construction for months, and if Biden nixes the permit, Trudeau probably won’t invite him to the next neighborhood block party. Alberta Premier Jason Kenney told CBC it would also hurt US and Canadian jobs and undermine national security by leaving America dependent on OPEC imports. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>It's <a href="https://www.nationalgeographic.com/science/2020/07/keystone-xl-stalls-again-along-with-other-pipelines/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tough out there</a> for a pipeline. In the last year, the Atlantic Coast pipeline was canceled, a judge temporarily shut down the Dakota Access Pipeline, and the Supreme Court upheld a suspension on construction of parts of the Keystone XL. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/18/joe-biden-nominates-choices-top-financial-regulatory-positions?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Regulators, Assemble
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Ron Burgundy blowing a conch shell " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/cCalRsU3yKZoQILEEI/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Ron Burgundy blowing a conch shell " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/cCalRsU3yKZoQILEEI/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If Joe Biden were putting together the Avengers of financial regulation, he just found his Thor and Hulk. Yesterday, the president-elect <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/17/politics/gary-gensler-rohit-chopra-sec-cfpb-nominations/index.html?utm_term=link&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twCNNp&utm_content=2021-01-18T01%3A41%3A02&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nominated</a> Gary Gensler to serve as commissioner of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and Rohit Chopra to head up the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB). </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Their backstories: </strong>Gary Gensler is a former Goldman Sachs exec-turned-financial-watchdog under President Obama, while Chopra headed up the student loan division of the CFPB following the 2008 financial crisis. Both are members of the Sen. Elizabeth Warren coaching tree, which means they'll take an aggressive approach to regulating banks.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If confirmed, Gensler and Chopra could take their pick from a buffet of potential <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-18/biden-s-wall-street-watchdogs-signal-new-era-of-tough-oversight?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">regulatory side dishes</a>:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Gensler could focus on Robinhood's "gamification" of trading, Chinese companies ignoring US auditing rules, or the Wild West of crypto regulation.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Chopra will likely address the student loan crisis, as well as the heavy overdraft fees banks levy on consumers.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Both nominations are seen as major wins for progressives hoping to rein in Wall Street. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/18/latest-global-vaccine-rollout?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
So How Goes the Vaccine Rollout?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="vaccine clock" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNzU5L3ZhY2NpbmVfY2xvY2suanBlZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Seems like an important question. Here's the latest from the world of shots and jabs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">US: </strong>The governors of Oregon, Minnesota, and Colorado have criticized the Trump administration for <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/17/world/trump-vaccine-doses.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sowing confusion</a> after they found out their states would receive fewer doses than expected under new CDC guidelines. New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo is exploring if his state can buy vaccines directly from Pfizer. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But more help is on the way. Dr. Anthony Fauci </span><span><a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/fauci-covid-vaccine-fda-approval-johnson-johnson-astrazeneca-2021-1?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a></span><span> two more vaccines (via AstraZeneca and Johnson & Johnson) could be approved within weeks. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Norway: </strong>After at least 33 nursing home residents died after receiving a Covid vaccine, health authorities said there’s no evidence the deaths <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-18/norway-finds-no-direct-link-between-elderly-deaths-and-vaccine?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">were connected</a> with receiving the shot, as the residents were already seriously ill prior to being vaccinated.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">France: </strong>The country is running significantly behind other wealthy nations in its vaccination program—only administering 422,000 doses in more than three weeks, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/france-once-a-vaccine-pioneer-is-top-skeptic-in-covid-19-pandemic-11610971051?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the WSJ</a>. France has one of the more vaccine-skeptical populations. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brazil: </strong>Regulators in the world's sixth-most populous country <a href="https://news.yahoo.com/brazil-health-agency-approves-two-192204382.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">approved</a> the use of coronavirus vaccines from AstraZeneca and China's Sinovac. Neighboring countries Chile and Argentina have already begun immunizing people. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F01%2F18%2Flatest-global-vaccine-rollout" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=France+is+running+significantly+behind+other+wealthy+nations+in+its+vaccination+program&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/18/latest-global-vaccine-rollout&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You’ve probably heard the hoopla around 5G, but did you ever think of how you could potentially <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-5g-sc-1k?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5gsa-supercycle-1k&aid=9467&paid=9467&waid=9467&source=esamnbwdg0210138&psource=esamnbwdg0210138&wsource=esamnbwdg0210138" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">make a pretty penny off such a little piece of technology</a>? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Well we sure as heck didn’t. So it’s a good thing Motley Fool cofounder David Gardner and his Stock Market Advisor team have got us covered. They’ve put together <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-5g-sc-1k?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5gsa-supercycle-1k&aid=9467&paid=9467&waid=9467&source=esamnbwdg0210138&psource=esamnbwdg0210138&wsource=esamnbwdg0210138" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this report</a> as a guide to investors on Apple’s next must-have device.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The report features the inside scoop on an <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-5g-sc-1k?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5gsa-supercycle-1k&aid=9467&paid=9467&waid=9467&source=esamnbwdg0210138&psource=esamnbwdg0210138&wsource=esamnbwdg0210138" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">under-the-radar company</a> that makes <strong style="color:#000">a component so essential to the improvements in Apple’s 5G iPhone that Apple is expected to include it in every single new iPhone they make</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In other words, this tiny American company is the apple of Apple’s eye, and <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-5g-sc-1k?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5gsa-supercycle-1k&aid=9467&paid=9467&waid=9467&source=esamnbwdg0210138&psource=esamnbwdg0210138&wsource=esamnbwdg0210138" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">investing just $1,000</a> in this microchip megawonder could potentially be an even more lucrative way to play the coming iPhone supercycle.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-5g-sc-1k?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=5gsa-supercycle-1k&aid=9467&paid=9467&waid=9467&source=esamnbwdg0210138&psource=esamnbwdg0210138&wsource=esamnbwdg0210138" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Learn more and get The Motley Fool’s report on the 5G Supercycle today</a>.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MANUFACTURING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/18/global-semiconductor-shortages-hobble-auto-industry-production?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Automakers Right Now
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Nick from 'New Girl' saying "Help meee!"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=305 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Fex8y28xO00Fi/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Nick from 'New Girl' saying " Help meee!"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Fex8y28xO00Fi/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You know when you're about to complete a jigsaw puzzle only to find out one<em> </em>piece is missing? Automakers are currently experiencing that on a global scale after a <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/18/business/ford-auto-chip-shortage/index.html?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+rss%2Fcnn_topstories+%28RSS%3A+CNN+-+Top+Stories%29&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shortage</a> of semiconductor chips forced Ford and Volkswagen to temporarily scale down production.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What's to blame?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Automakers say they aren't getting the attention they deserve from chipmakers, who are fulfilling higher-margin consumer electronics orders first. But chipmakers say that the automakers played themselves by dramatically reducing orders in the early days of the pandemic. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The problem is so acute that a lobbying body representing GM, Ford, and other US car manufacturers has been pressing the incoming president and VP to convince Asian semiconductor companies to <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-15/u-s-automakers-plead-for-government-help-in-growing-chip-crisis?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">allocate more chips</a> toward Suburbans and Mustangs and away from iPhones and laptops. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Even if the Biden administration were to flex its diplomatic muscles, there's not much it could do. Manufacturers need at least three months to scale up chip production. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MUSIC
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/18/morgan-wallens-new-album-sets-country-music-streaming-record?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Mullets Are Back
</font></a>
</h1>

<img alt="Morgan Wallen " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNzU4L21vcmdhbl93YWxsZW4uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Jason Kempin/ACMA2020/Getty Images for ACM</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Raise your finest koozie to Morgan Wallen, whose <em>Dangerous: The Double Album </em>just had the <a href="https://www.billboard.com/articles/business/chart-beat/9512768/morgan-wallen-dangerous-the-double-album-billboard-200-debut-country-streaming-record?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">biggest streaming week ever</a> for a country album, squashing No. 2 Luke Combs by more than 2x. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quick bio: </strong>Wallen, a 27-year-old raised in a small town in Eastern Tennessee, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/morgan-wallen-tops-charts-driving-surge-in-country-music-streaming-11610976928?mod=hp_listc_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">got his break</a> as a contestant on <em>The Voice </em>in 2014.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Six years, one album, and many hits later, Wallen earned headlines for the wrong reasons last fall, when </span><span><em>SNL </em></span><span>rescinded an invitation to perform after a video surfaced of Wallen partying without a mask. He finally made it to the famous stage a few months later.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Wallen's rise has been propelled by a number of industry trends, including Americans' increased appetite for country music during the pandemic and the sweet, <a href="https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2020/12/28/how-morgan-wallen-became-the-most-wanted-man-in-country?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">viral touch</a> of TikTok. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ While we're here: </strong>Streaming records were made to be broken. Olivia Rodrigo's debut single "drivers license" just notched the <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/18/entertainment/olivia-rodrigo-drivers-license-spotify-trnd/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most streams</a> in a single week on Spotify.</p>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/19/trump-preparing-to-lift-europe-brazil-covid-19-travel-restrictions-jan-26.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">President Trump</a></span><span> is planning to lift travel restrictions on visitors from Brazil and Europe starting Jan. 26, but the incoming Biden administration is expected to reverse the order. </span>

<span>

<span>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nENERGY\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/18/biden-rescind-keystone-xl-permit?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nPipeline on the Line\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A map showing the path of the Keystone XL pipeline. The original pipeline goes east from Hardisty, Canada and straight down the middle of the US to Cushing, TX, and Patoka, IN. The proposed XL detour cuts through Montana, South Dakota, and Nebraska. \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNzYyL2tleXN0b25lX3BpcGVsaW5lLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAmong a spree of executive orders planned for his first day in office tomorrow, POTUS-elect Joe Biden will reportedly \u003ca href=\"https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/calgary/biden-keystone-xl-1.5877038?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erescind a permit\u003c/a\u003e for the Keystone XL pipeline. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eRefresher: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Keystone XL is a planned 1,210-mile detour from the existing Keystone pipeline, which runs from Canada’s Alberta province to Gulf Coast oil refineries. The Keystone XL would haul 830,000 barrels of crude oil per day through Montana, South Dakota, and Nebraska before reconnecting to the original pipeline. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe American Dream mall of fossil fuel projects, the Keystone XL has been in the works for 15+ years but faced numerous delays and legal setbacks, including former President Obama's 2015 rejection of its permit application.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhy the controversy?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEnvironmentalists strongly oppose the pipeline because it 1) is an $8 billion investment in harmful fossil fuels 2) cuts through protected wetlands and tribal lands and 3) carries \"bitumen\" from Alberta’s oil sands, a type of crude oil that creates more pollution. Some major banks have stopped financing all oil sands projects because of the climate impact.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCanada's ambassador to the US says oil sands production and emissions per barrel have improved since the project was announced, and Canadian PM Justin Trudeau and President Trump, supporters of Keystone XL, argue it will reduce reliance on foreign oil and create jobs. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Sunday, the Keystone XL's developer \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/keystone-xl-oil-project-pledges-zero-carbon-emissions-11610930642?mod=hp_lead_pos2\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etried convincing\u003c/a\u003e Biden it won't be like those other fossil fuel projects, pledging...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e$1.7 billion in solar, wind, and battery investments\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNet-zero emissions after starting service in 2023\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA ~$785 million stake in the project for indigenous tribes\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Canadian portion has been under construction for months, and if Biden nixes the permit, Trudeau probably won’t invite him to the next neighborhood block party. Alberta Premier Jason Kenney told CBC it would also hurt US and Canadian jobs and undermine national security by leaving America dependent on OPEC imports. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eIt's \u003ca href=\"https://www.nationalgeographic.com/science/2020/07/keystone-xl-stalls-again-along-with-other-pipelines/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etough out there\u003c/a\u003e for a pipeline. In the last year, the Atlantic Coast pipeline was canceled, a judge temporarily shut down the Dakota Access Pipeline, and the Supreme Court upheld a suspension on construction of parts of the Keystone XL. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf Joe Biden were putting together the Avengers of financial regulation, he just found his Thor and Hulk. Yesterday, the president-elect \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/17/politics/gary-gensler-rohit-chopra-sec-cfpb-nominations/index.html?utm_term=link\u0026utm_medium=social\u0026utm_source=twCNNp\u0026utm_content=2021-01-18T01%3A41%3A02\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enominated\u003c/a\u003e Gary Gensler to serve as commissioner of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and Rohit Chopra to head up the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTheir backstories: \u003c/strong\u003eGary Gensler is a former Goldman Sachs exec-turned-financial-watchdog under President Obama, while Chopra headed up the student loan division of the CFPB following the 2008 financial crisis. Both are members of the Sen. Elizabeth Warren coaching tree, which means they'll take an aggressive approach to regulating banks.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf confirmed, Gensler and Chopra could take their pick from a buffet of potential \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-18/biden-s-wall-street-watchdogs-signal-new-era-of-tough-oversight?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eregulatory side dishes\u003c/a\u003e:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGensler could focus on Robinhood's \"gamification\" of trading, Chinese companies ignoring US auditing rules, or the Wild West of crypto regulation.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eChopra will likely address the student loan crisis, as well as the heavy overdraft fees banks levy on consumers.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Both nominations are seen as major wins for progressives hoping to rein in Wall Street. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: Here's the latest from the world of shots and jabs.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eUS: \u003c/strong\u003eThe governors of Oregon, Minnesota, and Colorado have criticized the Trump administration for \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/17/world/trump-vaccine-doses.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esowing confusion\u003c/a\u003e after they found out their states would receive fewer doses than expected under new CDC guidelines. New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo is exploring if his state can buy vaccines directly from Pfizer. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBut more help is on the way. Dr. Anthony Fauci \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/fauci-covid-vaccine-fda-approval-johnson-johnson-astrazeneca-2021-1?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e two more vaccines (via AstraZeneca and Johnson \u0026 Johnson) could be approved within weeks. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNorway: \u003c/strong\u003eAfter at least 33 nursing home residents died after receiving a Covid vaccine, health authorities said there’s no evidence the deaths \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-18/norway-finds-no-direct-link-between-elderly-deaths-and-vaccine?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewere connected\u003c/a\u003e with receiving the shot, as the residents were already seriously ill prior to being vaccinated.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFrance: \u003c/strong\u003eThe country is running significantly behind other wealthy nations in its vaccination program—only administering 422,000 doses in more than three weeks, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/france-once-a-vaccine-pioneer-is-top-skeptic-in-covid-19-pandemic-11610971051?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper the WSJ\u003c/a\u003e. France has one of the more vaccine-skeptical populations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBrazil: \u003c/strong\u003eRegulators in the world's sixth-most populous country \u003ca href=\"https://news.yahoo.com/brazil-health-agency-approves-two-192204382.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eapproved\u003c/a\u003e the use of coronavirus vaccines from AstraZeneca and China's Sinovac. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou know when you're about to complete a jigsaw puzzle only to find out one\u003cem\u003e \u003c/em\u003epiece is missing? Automakers are currently experiencing that on a global scale after a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/18/business/ford-auto-chip-shortage/index.html?utm_source=feedburner\u0026utm_medium=feed\u0026utm_campaign=Feed%3A+rss%2Fcnn_topstories+%28RSS%3A+CNN+-+Top+Stories%29\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshortage\u003c/a\u003e of semiconductor chips forced Ford and Volkswagen to temporarily scale down production.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat's to blame?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAutomakers say they aren't getting the attention they deserve from chipmakers, who are fulfilling higher-margin consumer electronics orders first. But chipmakers say that the automakers played themselves by dramatically reducing orders in the early days of the pandemic. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe problem is so acute that a lobbying body representing GM, Ford, and other US car manufacturers has been pressing the incoming president and VP to convince Asian semiconductor companies to \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-15/u-s-automakers-plead-for-government-help-in-growing-chip-crisis?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eallocate more chips\u003c/a\u003e toward Suburbans and Mustangs and away from iPhones and laptops. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Even if the Biden administration were to flex its diplomatic muscles, there's not much it could do.
